name: Little Man Computer (Emulator)
short_description: The Little Man Computer (LMC) is an instructional model of a computer, created by Dr. Stuart Madnick in 1965. The LMC is generally used to teach students, because it models a simple von Neumann architecture computer, which has all of the basic features of a modern computer. It can be programmed in machine (albeit usually in decimal) or assembly code. This software is a complete IDE and Emulator for implementing and designing applications that is capable for using Little Man Computer
summary: Emulation Software for Little Man Computer
